metadata.title: CVE-2014-3188 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Google Chrome before 38.0.2125.101 and Chrome OS before 38.0.2125.101 donot properly handle the interaction of IPC and Google V8, which allowsremote attackers to execute arbitrary code via vectors involving JSON data,related to improper parsing of an escaped index by ParseJsonObject injson-parser.h.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3188` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103
chromium-browser-l10n - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103
chromium-chromedriver - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.2.5-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.2.5-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.2.5-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.2.5-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.2.5-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.2.5-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.5-0ubuntu1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
